required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Feasibility of Reversible Induction Strategy
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Feasibility of Reversible Induction Strategy Supported by HFNC Combined With Specific Anesthetic

brief_summary.textblock: This study would explore the safety and feasibility of a reversible induction strategy for uncertain difficult airway. This reversible induction strategy would include high flow nasal canular oxygenation support, short-term effect anesthetic including Propofol and Remifentanil for sedation and analgesia and Sugammadex would be used for reverse the muscle relaxant.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of induction to 15min later

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of induction to 15min later
From the beginning of induction to 15min later

secondary_outcome.measure: Tidal volume 6-8ml tidal volume 6-8ml/kg reversion time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of induction to 15min later
From the beginning of induction to 15min later

study_pop.textblock: Patients with an uncertain difficult airway, who will undergo a selective operation and need trachea intubtion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >18 years old,<65 years old
- Signed informed consent
- Undergoing selective operation （ time of operation is over two hours）
- ASA classification I-II
- Mallampati classification 3-4
- suspicious difficult airway, but the anesthetists decide to try to rapid induction
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with several dysfunctions of liver, kidney or heart)
- Patients with a full stomach or have other risk factors of reflux aspiration
- Any medicine was taken before surgery, which might enhance or mitigate the effects of muscle relaxant
- Infection of the mouth or nose
- Allergy history of any medicine which would be used in this study
- Pregnant and lactating women
- Patients with neuromuscular disease

overall_official.affiliation: Renji Hospital, Shanghai Jiaotong University, Shanghai, China

facility.name: Ren Ji Hospital Affliated to School of Medicine, Shanghai Jiao Tong University

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD is unavailable to other researchers
